lines.text: You couldn't find your dick in a windstorm.
What about Huxley? What is that?

He was referring to a quote by Thomas Huxley, "The chessboard is the world... the rules of the game are what we call nature. The player on the other side is hidden from us but we know that his play is always fair, just, and patient. We also know that he never overlooks a mistake.
Eventually revenge is carefully arranged.
I've got a drunk for a wife and a lunatic for a son. I don't need this shit anymore. You're crazy, both of you.
Pain. Pain is just a state of mind. It's something you learn to live with; I have.
Computers... that's the way you got into Randall's Roxford's records... You can get into anything
Yes I can... Including your mind! I'm in there right now aren't I Peter? I'll always be with you no matter how disturbed I get

You think that I put you through some BIG ORDEAL? It is nothing compared to what you have caused me! In your eyes, I was just another small town boy to be crushed beneath the shoes of the great child genius.
Nothing I could have done to you, nothing warrants what you did.
Pain is relative, remember. You can not judge mine.

[as David moves forward]
STAY WHERE YOU ARE!
You still haven't figured it out have you? Tell me Peter... do you still have scars? Scars from where I stabbed you with my fountain pen?
I've always wanted to learn how to play chess. It seems like a complicated game.
Well, not really. You see your goal and go after it. Anything that gets in the way is an obstacle and must be destroyed.
Sounds very violent...
Chess is a reflexion of life, life is violent. The strong win, the weak perish.
You enjoy being the stronger one?
If you're asking me if I'm passionate about what I do, the answer is yes. Without passion, nothing moves us.
Please, I don't want to get into the psychological aspects of my actions. It would detract from the game.
How?
I couldn't say it better than Huxley.
Well, Huxley's quote also says, "for his play is always fair and just."
So, is mine within the framework of my rules.
You're acting like a superstitious schoolboy, Peter. What's next, incense and Rosary beads?
Oh, we wouldn't want someone's death to interfere with your games. What was your relationship with her?
Causal.
Causal? You were boning her, weren't you?
It wasn't serious. What's your prolem?
You are. I don't like you.
Fine, don't ask me out on a date.
Don't worry, I won't. I've seen how your dates end up.
What is this?
I'm just trying to get to know you better.
By atacking me.
Attack you? You set your life up like one of your chessboards. YOu're impassable. You've become trapped behind your defenses. You're cut off from everybody around you.
What are you talking about? You don't know me.
Does anyone?
[last lines]
Game's Over!
You shouldn't have said those horrible things about me... you don't know what I am

[On why the killer attacked her in the asylum]
What if he came he because he's a patient? An out patient?

[On why the killer attacked her in the asylum]
What if he came here because he's really a patient? An out patient?

[Last sympathetic lines]
I'm sure your mommy knows that David... I'm sure she understands... I mean children make mistakes David... it's okay.
[pleading]
David... put down the knife now please David... just put down the knife... David... put down the knife please David?

[Last Lines]
I... Can't...
